warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead, bend the elbow, and use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow back. Alternate arms. Perform 2 sets of 15 seconds per arm.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start in a plank position with hands under shoulders.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Tap each shoulder with the opposite hand, alternating sides. Perform 2 sets of 20 taps.
Swing arms forward and backward in a controlled manner. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with both hands and stand with your back to the cable machine.
2. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the bar behind your head, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, keeping tension on the triceps throughout.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a rope to a low pulley. Stand facing away from the machine, holding the rope with both hands overhead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the rope with both hands and stand with your back to the cable machine.
2. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the rope behind your head, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, keeping tension on the triceps throughout.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a resistance band that provides similar tension to the cable setup, ensuring you can complete 10-12 reps.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary to maximize the stretch and contraction of the triceps.

exercises.setup: Use an EZ bar or straight bar. Lie on a bench with the bar overhead.
execution: 1. Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold the bar with an overhand grip, arms extended above your chest.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the bar towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, focusing on the stretch and contraction of the triceps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended overhead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells behind your head, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, focusing on the stretch and contraction of the triceps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select dumbbells that allow you to perform 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction of the triceps.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your elbows remain close to your head to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise.

exercises.setup: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
execution: 1. Stand facing the machine and grip the bar with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body and press the bar down until your arms are fully extended.
3. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your triceps.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a rope to a high pulley. Stand facing the machine, holding the rope with both hands.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand facing the machine and grip the rope with both hands.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body and press the rope down, separating the ends as you extend your arms.
3. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your triceps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a resistance band that provides similar tension to the cable setup, ensuring you can complete 10-12 reps.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary and avoid using momentum to complete the reps.
